conclusion: Analyze paths of liquid from points A, B, C, and D to predict flow into containers E or F.
Liquid flows from A to the right.
Liquid from A encounters a baffle directing it downward.
Liquid from A flows into container E.
Liquid flows from B to the right.
Liquid from B encounters a baffle directing it downward.
Liquid from B flows into container E.
Liquid flows from C to the right.
Liquid from C encounters a baffle directing it downward.
Liquid from C flows into container F.
Liquid flows from D to the right.
Liquid from D encounters a baffle directing it downward.
Liquid from D flows into container F.
Liquids from A and B flow into container E; liquids from C and D flow into container F.
Final answer: Liquid from A and B will flow into container E, and liquid from C and D will flow into container F.
